title: Christine Lagarde - Wikipedia
snippet: In December 2016, a French court convicted her of negligence relating to her role in the Bernard Tapie arbitration, but did not impose a penalty. Lagarde resigned from the IMF following her nomination as president of the ECB. In 2019, 2020, 2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025, Forbes ranked her number two on its World's 100 Most Powerful Women list. title: Christine Lagarde
snippet: Lagarde has been involved in three significant long-term relationships, with varying marital outcomes. Her first confirmed marriage was to French financial analyst Wilfried Lagarde in 1982, which ultimately ended in divorce in 1992.
